title: MOVSLDUP â€” Replicate Single FP Values

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`MOVSLDUP xmm1, xmm2/m128`
`VMOVSLDUP xmm1, xmm2/m128`
`VMOVSLDUP ymm1, ymm2/m256`
`VMOVSLDUP xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2/m128`
`VMOVSLDUP ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2/m256`
`VMOVSLDUP zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2/m512`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Duplicates even-indexed single-precision floating-point values from the source operand (the second operand). See Figure 4-4. The source operand is an XMM, YMM or ZMM register or 128, 256 or 512-bit memory location and the destination operand is an XMM, YMM or ZMM register.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: 128-bit Legacy SSE version: Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding destination register remain unchanged.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.128 encoded version: Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the destination register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.256 encoded version: Bits (MAXVL-1:256) of the destination register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX encoded version: The destination operand is updated at 32-bit granularity according to the writemask.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Note: VEX.vvvv and EVEX.vvvv are reserved and must be 1111b otherwise instructions will #UD.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
